meanings.definition: The amount that a dipper can hold.
meanings.sent1: She poured herself a dipperful of water from the well.
meanings.sent2: He measured out a dipperful of rice for the recipe.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty cat lapped up a dipperful of milk in one go.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a dipperful of tears, ready to spill over.
meanings.sent5: The old well could only yield a dipperful of water at a time.

meanings.definition: The act of dipping something into a liquid.
meanings.sent1: His quick dipperful of the cookie left crumbs in the milk.
meanings.sent2: The child's dipperful of paint created a swirl of colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: She performed a graceful dipperful of the strawberry into the chocolate fondue.
meanings.sent4: The dipperful of the brush into the water jar created a beautiful watercolor effect.
meanings.sent5: The chef's precise dipperful of the spoon into the sauce added the perfect flavor.

meanings.definition: A small ladle or scoop used for serving liquids.
meanings.sent1: The waiter used a dipperful to serve the soup into the bowl.
meanings.sent2: Grandma's dipperful was always the perfect size for serving hot cocoa.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her toy shovel was a dipperful for her tea party.
meanings.sent4: The dipperful gleamed in the sunlight as it scooped up the lemonade.
meanings.sent5: The dipperful clinked against the glass as he served the refreshing drink.
